DOC.brief_summary: Randomised, placebo-controlled dose-response intervention study with vitamin D3 in pregnant women.
DOC.brief_title: Nutritional Requirements for Vitamin D in Pregnant Women
DOC.detailed_description: This is a four-arm, parallel, double-blind, placebo-controlled dose-response intervention study with vitamin D3. Women will be recruited during the first trimester and followed-up throughout their pregnancy. White women will be randomised to receive placebo, 10 or 20 mcg/d of vitamin D3 from baseline visit in their first trimester until delivery. Dark skinned women will receive 20 mcg/d. Blood samples will be taken once in each trimester and also from the cord at delivery. A 25-hydroxyvitamin D concentration of 30 nmol/L will be used to denote clinical deficiency and 50 nmol/L to indicate sufficient vitamin D status. Information on maternal anthropometry, diet, lifestyle, sun exposure, blood pressure and serum total calcium will also be reported.
DOC.criteria: Adult (>18 years) No more than 18 weeks gestation In good general health Low risk pregnancy Not consuming >10 mcg/d vitamin D from supplements Current smokers Diagnosed hypertension Known highrisk pregnancy Diagnosed medical illness including diabetes mellitus (Types 1 & 2), chronic kidney disease or gastrointestinal diseases or any illness known to interfere with calcium metabolism (e.g. sarcoidosis). Consumption of medications known to interfere with vitamin D metabolism Consumption of vitamin D (≥ 10 µg/day) or calcium (≥ 650 mg/d) supplements prior to randomization
